Package org.efs.event

package org.efs.event
Contains classes which define efs events. This includes:
  • IEfsEvent: marker interface which all efs event classes are required to implement.
  • ConflationEvent: used to dispatch only latest event to an agent. The idea is that if an event for a given subject is dispatched to an agent and another event arrives before the agent receives that first event, then the first event is dropped and replaced with the second event. This means that the agent never sees the first event but only the second event.
  • EfsEventWrapper: Enriches an encapsulated event with: publish timestamp, event identifier, publisher identifier, and the number of subscribers receiving the event when event was published. The idea is that publish timestamp and event identifier together uniquely identify an event.
  • Related Packages
    Package
    Description
    org.efs.event.type
    Contains EfsEventLayout class which provides a reflective definition of an IEfsEvent class.
  • Class
    Description
    ConflationEvent<E extends IEfsEvent>
    This mutable event allows changing the encapsulated event instance even when this ConflationEvent is posted to an agent event queue.
    EfsCollectionInfo
    Method-level, run-time annotation defining maximum number of elements allowed in a collection or array.
    EfsEventWrapper<E extends IEfsEvent>
    This class provides meta-information concerning the encapsulated event.
    EfsEventWrapper.Builder<E extends IEfsEvent>
    Builder for constructing an EfsEventWrapper instance.
    EfsStringInfo
    Method-level, run-time annotation defining two attributes: charset: defines Charset used to encode/decode associated String type.
    IEfsEvent
    Marker interface denoting that a class is an efs event.
    IEfsEventBuilder<E extends IEfsEvent>
    Interface defines an efs event builder class used to create an IEfsEvent instance.
